revised_title: Progressive Paralysis of Nerve Cells in the Superior Cervical Ganglion
tldr: The authors conducted experiments on rabbits, cats, and dogs to study the order in which the effects of stimulating the sympathetic nerve cease when injecting small doses of nicotin. They discovered that the nerve cells in the superior cervical ganglion are paralyzed in a definite order, and the sympathetic nerve has both vasoconstrictor and vasodilator fibers for the bucco-labial region.
